entry.p: At a keysigning in Brussels last week during the XMPP Summit, I learned that the DSA algorithm I used to generate my current OpenPGP key (ID 0DB0FEFC) back in 2008 is now considered to be less than fully secure. Therefore I've generated a new key, this time using the RSA algorithm. While I was at it, I upped the keysize from 1024 to 4096. The new KeyID is 2BC5ADA9, and the fingerprint is 3B58 0662 73C6 F1A7 87F8 947D EA06 A491 2BC5 ADA9. The file located at http://stpeter.im/stpeter.asc now contains the ASCII armored output of the new key.
